intro: Linociera pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered linociera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Linociera pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
